column4: after he has installed windows how is he going to boot ubuntu to run grub-update?
arunkumar413: you will need a bootable usb pen drive or cd disk or pxe boot or ??
yes i agree but he said he doesn't have a livecd and its not really practical to get one
and usb flash drive or pxe are those posible?
i wouldn't know about pxe, but he just said no to cd or usb
at that point I would go to the store and get a new $3 usb flash disk then, or maybe a spare hard disk?
i don't know his circumstances sorry, usbs are cheap here in the uk too
even if pxe boot off lan is posible it can get more complicated on the first run
isn't rmmod used to remove a module from the kernel? and modprobe to load/unload it?
that sound about write, but some devices need more time to settle
i think the manpages say to use modprobe -r to unload it
yes I also see that recomended in the man rmmod page,  but it's worked for me in the past, don't recall myself ever using the modprobe -r
can't say i have much experience with modprobe myself (yay, i'm learning)
ya modprobe -r looks better since it also pulls other modules that depend on the one you remove
ah, cool
doesn't networkmanager overwrite /etc/network/interfaces ?
not as far as I know,  maybe at install?  but I was told the method to set static was to modify /etc/network/interfaces
ah, i may be remembering wrongly then, thanks for the info
sda6 is a linux partitition
is that a question if so yes
so you meant fsxk not chkdsk?
your right fsck  mino123  sudo fsck /dev/sda6
